contextId.information: This refers to people who do nothing all day but drink alcoholic drinks. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: those who rise up early in the morning ... who linger late into the night

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) this emphasizes that God will completely destroy the forests and farmlands. AT: "completely" or 2) this means God will completely destroy the people of Assyria. The phrase "soul and body" refers to the spiritual part and the physical part of a person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

Yahweh uses the words "far away" and "near" to mean all people. The word "might" can be expressed with the adjective "mighty." AT: "All people everywhere hear what I have done and acknowledge that I am mighty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]] and  [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: You who are far away, hear what I have done; and, you who are near, acknowledge my might

contextId.information: This means all of the time. AT: "It will burn throughout the night and the day" or "It will burn constantly, all night and all day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: It will burn night and day

contextId.information: This refers to all activities of life. AT: "I know everything you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: But I know your sitting down, your going out, your coming in

contextId.information: "you lowest parts of the earth." Possible meanings are 1) that this refers to very deep places on the earth such as caves or canyons and forms a merism with "heavens" in the previous phrase or 2) that this refers to the place of the dead. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
Since the sun rises in the east, this phrase forms a merism and means everywhere on earth. AT: "from every place on earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: from the rising of the sun, and from the west

contextId.information: The places on the earth that are very far away are spoken of as if they were the places where the earth ends. This phrase also forms a merism and refers to everywhere in between the ends. AT "to all the farthest places of the earth" or "to the entire earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: to the ends of the earth

contextId.information: Both are extremes that also represent everything between. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: new heavens and a new earth
